avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow is settling and has thawed in warm conditions and gaining strength. Risk of slip and slide in icey conditions early morning high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has thawed and significantly melted in the warmth of the past week. Continued warmth is expected and stiff easterly winds. The snow is likely to have become isothermal up to the highest mountain peaks. There is a risk of slip and slide in ice conditions early in the day in the highest mountains.

travelAdvisory.comment: The temperature has been above freezing, even at higher elevations, causing the snow to settle and become wet. Significant melting of snow has occurred as a result across the country. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which should help strengthen the snowpack. Many avalanches released in the East and North of Iceland during the thaw and afterward, due to warming and solar radiation.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches. Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of diurnal freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar áttir, milt og fremur þurrt. Næturfrost til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches since the warming on Monday, March 4th. The avalanches were rather small and stopped in the middle of the slopes. Snow slab avalanches fell in Skálavík on Sunday, March 3rd. Some small loose avalanches occurred on thin layers after the thaw last weekend in Seljalandsdal.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted in the recent warm weather, and measurements indicate that the snowpack has become isothermal in many mountainous areas. It can be expected to further strengthen with overnight frost in the coming days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during this week"s warm weather, and temperatures have been above freezing both in the mountains and in low-lying areas since Monday. Snow stakes indicate that the snowpack has generally reached isothermal conditions after the warmth. It can be expected that it will further consolidate in the cooling weather and overnight frost in the coming days.

travelAdvisory.comment: The temperature has been above freezing, even at higher elevations, causing the snow to settle and become wet. Significant melting of snow has occurred as a result across the country. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which should help strengthen the snowpack. Many avalanches released in the East and North of Iceland during the thaw and afterward, due to warming and solar radiation.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches. Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of diurnal freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður yfir helgina, milt í veðri og úrkomulítið næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several small avalanches, minor slabs, and loose snow avalanches released on SE aspects on Sunday and Monday during warming. On Saturday, a roughly 50-meter wide slab released on a steep S aspect in Upsadal above Dalvík, likely triggered by snowmobile activity. Several more avalanches occurred over the weekend, at least one of which was human-triggered.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened considerably in the area after prolonged warming up in the mountains since Monday. Overnight frost during the weekend will further strengthen the snow. Instability was found in older wind slabs last weekend and this weakness is likely still present higher up in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened during warming in all elevations since Monday. Instability was observed in wind-loaded areas last weekend, suggesting that this weakness may still exist in higher elevations. Significant warming in the mountains caused avalanche activity on Monday. The snow has been consolidating throughout the week and will continue to do so with the upcoming overnight frosts over the weekend, and diurnal temperature fluctuations are currently affecting surface snow on S-aspects. Weaknesses are expected to persist at higher elevations and in the interior of Tröllaskagi.

travelAdvisory.comment: The temperature has been above freezing, even at higher elevations, causing the snow to settle and become wet. Significant melting of snow has occurred as a result across the country. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which should help strengthen the snowpack. Many avalanches released in the East and North of Iceland during the thaw and afterward, due to warming and solar radiation.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming across the country since Monday has resulted in numerous avalanches. Cooling weather is expected over the weekend and the snowpack will strengthen as a result of diurnal freeze-thaw cycles.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður, úrkomulaust og næturfrost um helgina.

avalancheActivity.comment: Rather small slab avalanches released 6th March due to solar radiation in highest mountains in Fjarðarheiði and around Seyðisfjörður. When temperature rose on Monday several avalanches released in the forecasting area. Off piste skiers triggered three slab avalanches on March 2nd, both in Stafdalur and Oddsskarð.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. In the lower parts of the mountains, the snow should strengthen in the coming days and generally be stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. Observation near Oddsskarð showed rather uniform and stable snow but moist layered snow in the top 20 cm. In the lower parts of the mountains, the snow should strengthen in the coming days and generally be stable. Around 20 cm of new snow is expected higher up in the mountains in the northeast direction over the weekend

travelAdvisory.comment: The temperature has been above freezing, even at higher elevations, causing the snow to settle and become wet. Significant melting of snow has occurred as a result across the country. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which should help strengthen the snowpack. Many avalanches released in the East and North of Iceland during the thaw and afterward, due to warming and solar radiation.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar suðaustan og austan áttir næstu daga, og stöku skúrir en snjóél til fjalla. Kólnandi veður.
